notes: “While the city sleeps,” New Yorkers used to joke, “the watchmen do too.” Watchmen tried not to sleep when sitting in sentry boxes. If a gang of young rowdies found a night watchman dozing, they’d knock the box over and lasso and drag it, and its imprisoned leatherhead, through the mud. New York didn’t have a Municipal Police, with day and night patrols, until 1845. For more on the watch and the police that followed, see citations for this paragraph.
